SEARCH
Package uk.ac.aber.cs21120.knockout.interfaces

Interface IMatchTree

All Known Implementing Classes:
MatchTree
public interface IMatchTree
This interface describes how other code interacts with a set of matches in an elimination competition. Implementing classes must also provide a constructor taking an array of ITeam objects.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ITreeNode
    getNextMatch()
    Return the node which represents the next node to be played.
    ITreeNode
    getRoot()
    return the root node of the tree.
    void
    setScore(int leftScore, int rightScore)
    Set the score of the last node found with getNextMatch().

  • Method Details

    • getRoot

      ITreeNode getRoot()
      return the root node of the tree. This really shouldn't be necessary, and it breaks encapsulation - but it does allow us to print the entire tree.
      Returns:
      the root node

    • getNextMatch

      ITreeNode getNextMatch()
      Return the node which represents the next node to be played. This is a node which: - does not have its Team set (i.e. calling getTeam() will return null for that node) - has two child nodes - both child nodes have their Teams set
      Returns:
      the next match to be played

    • setScore

      void setScore(int leftScore, int rightScore)
      Set the score of the last node found with getNextMatch(). If there are no matches to be played, or getNextMatch() has never been called, it should throw a RuntimeException.
      Parameters:
      leftScore - score of team in left child node
      rightScore - score of team in right child node
